thread.title: S & T Bancorp Rating Lowered to Hold at Zacks (STBA)
thread.title_full: S & T Bancorp Rating Lowered to Hold at Zacks (STBA)

title: S & T Bancorp Rating Lowered to Hold at Zacks (STBA)
text:
Tweet 
S & T Bancorp (NASDAQ:STBA) was downgraded by Zacks from a “buy” rating to a “hold” rating in a report issued on Wednesday, Market Beat reports. 
According to Zacks, “S & T BANCORP, INC. is a bank holding company which is engaged in general banking business. The Bank is a full service bank with its main office in Indiana, Pennsylvania, providing service to its customers through a branch of 34 offices located in Armstrong, Allegheny, Indiana, Jefferson, Clearfield and Westmoreland counties. The Bank’s services include accepting time and demand deposit accounts, making secured and unsecured commercial and consumer loans, providing letters of credit, and offering discount brokerage services, personal financial planning and credit card services. “ 
STBA has been the topic of several other research reports. Piper Jaffray downgraded S & T Bancorp from an “overweight” rating to a “neutral” rating and lifted their target price for the company from $30.00 to $32.00 in a research note on Wednesday, July 22nd. They noted that the move was a valuation call. Keefe, Bruyette & Woods restated a “buy” rating on shares of S & T Bancorp in a report on Thursday, July 23rd. Finally, RBC Capital lifted their target price on S & T Bancorp from $29.00 to $32.00 and gave the stock a “sector perform” rating in a report on Wednesday, July 22nd. Five investment analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and one has given a buy rating to the stock. The stock currently has a consensus rating of “Hold” and an average price target of $32.00. 
Shares of S & T Bancorp ( NASDAQ:STBA ) traded up 0.46% during trading on Wednesday, reaching $30.74. The company’s stock had a trading volume of 68,189 shares. S & T Bancorp has a one year low of $23.07 and a one year high of $32.88. The stock’s 50 day moving average is $30.69 and its 200 day moving average is $28.97. The firm has a market cap of $1.07 billion and a P/E ratio of 16.06. 
S & T Bancorp (NASDAQ:STBA) last posted its earnings results on Tuesday, July 21st. The financial services provider reported $0.52 earnings per share for the quarter, beating the analysts’ consensus estimate of $0.48 by $0.04. The firm earned $62.20 million during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $59 million. During the same period in the prior year, the company posted $0.49 EPS. On average, equities analysts forecast that S & T Bancorp will post $2.04 EPS for the current fiscal year. 
The firm also recently declared a dividend, which will be paid on Thursday, August 20th. Investors of record on Thursday, August 6th will be paid a dividend of $0.18 per share. The ex-dividend date of this dividend is Tuesday, August 4th. 
In related news, Director James Thomas Gibson sold 75,000 shares of the business’s stock in a transaction on Thursday, July 23rd. The stock was sold at an average price of $32.54, for a total transaction of $2,440,500.00. The sale was disclosed in a filing with the SEC, which can be accessed through the SEC website . 
S&T Bancorp, Inc. ( NASDAQ:STBA ) is a bank holding company. The Company operates through its wholly owned subsidiaries, including   S&T operates   which   deposits,   services; Wealth Management, which offers   deeds, guardian and custodian of employee benefits and other trust and brokerage services, as well as a registered investment advisor that manages private investment accounts for individuals and institutions, and Insurance, includes an insurance agency offering commercial property and casualty insurance, group life and health coverage, employee benefit solutions and personal insurance lines.
